description: This context file describes the Chemist dashboard interface, which is composed of an HTML file for the structure and a JavaScript file for the client-side logic. The dashboard allows a chemist to view prescriptions, check inventory, and mark prescriptions as ready for pickup.

html_structure.description: The HTML file provides the user interface for the chemist.

header.content: Contains a level 1 heading with the title 'Chemist Dashboard'.

navigation.description: Provides navigation links to other sections of the application.

forms.description: A form for chemists to look up prescriptions. It is expected to fetch and display prescription details based on the input.
A form to check the status or availability of an item in the inventory.
A form that contains a button to mark a prescription as ready for patient pickup. This would likely trigger an update to the prescription's status in the backend.

javascript_logic.description: The JavaScript file will handle the dynamic aspects of the Chemist dashboard. It is expected to make API calls to a backend server to fetch and update data.

event_handlers.action: Should prevent the default form submission, get the value from the 'prescription-details' input, and make an API call to fetch prescription data. The returned data should be displayed on the page.
Should prevent the default form submission, get the value from the 'inventory-list' input, and make an API call to check the inventory. The result should be displayed.

Should prevent the default form submission and send a request to the backend to update the status of a specific prescription (likely identified by the 'patient-id' or 'prescription-details' input) to 'ready'.

api_calls.description: Fetches details for a specific prescription.
Checks the status of a specific inventory item.
Updates the status of a prescription. The body of the request would likely contain the new status, e.g., { 'status': 'ready' }.
